page.title: 16FISHING IN FLUSHING
page.content: In Flushing there is an active fishing community which with tourism is the major industries. We interviewed Charlie Powell of the Golden Fleece which a 55foot wooden hulled trawler. It is a big boat the average size of a boat being about 35feet. The fish caught off these waters include: mackeral, cod, whiting, ling, hake, conger, pollock. There are 5 men working on the Golden Fleece who have a long days work from 6.00a.m. to 8.00p.m. Now fishing is made easier with modern equipment such as sonar and the decca system (depth sounder and ship to shore radio) You can expect a catch of 50 stone when trawling. About 10 boats work off Flushing most of the crews come from fihing families.
